name: Los Lobos
description: '''Los Lobos''' ({{IPA|es|los ˈloβos|pron}}, Spanish for "the Wolves") is a [[Mexican Americans|Mexican American]] rock group, [[rock music|rock]] band from [[East Los Angeles, California]]. Their music is influenced by [[rock and roll]], [[Tejano music|Tex-Mex]], [[country music|country]], [[zydeco]], [[folk music|folk]], [[Rhythm and blues|R&B]], [[blues]], [[brown-eyed soul]], and traditional music such as [[cumbia]], [[bolero]]s and [[norteño (music)|norteño]]s. The band rose to international stardom in 1987, when their version of "[[La Bamba (song)|La Bamba]]" peaked at the top of the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]], and also topped the charts in the United Kingdom, and several other countries. Songs by Los Lobos have been recorded by [[Elvis Costello]], [[Waylon Jennings]], [[Frankie Yankovic]], and [[Robert Plant]]. In 2015, they were nominated for induction into the [[Rock and Roll Hall of Fame]]. In 2018, they were inducted into the ''[[Austin City Limits]]'' Hall of Fame. They are also known for performing the theme song for ''[[Handy Manny]]''. As of 2024, they have been nominated for twelve [[Grammy Awards]] and have won four.
